channel.title: Can you do Sets in scar?
channel.description:
Can you do Sets in scar?
Like it shows here. Scroll down to Key/Shift paramaters. http://delphi.about.com/od/objectpascalide/a/keyboard_events.htm
This would reaaaally help, I hope it's in there. :)

item.title: Can you do Sets in scar?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Nice translation cruel. I was just wondering, but I’m sure your code will definitely help. Thanks a lot.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you do Sets in scar?

item.title: Can you do Sets in scar?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Nope. For set arrays you could use something like this:

function VarInSet(iVar:Variant; iSet:TVariantArray): Boolean; var i:Integer; begin for i:= 0 to GetArrayLength(iSet)-1 do if iSet[i] = iVar then Result:= True; end;
Which would turn this:

if 6 in [3,7,3,1,9,6] then writeln('yes');

Into this:

if VarInSet(6,[3,7,3,1,9,6]) then writeln('yes');

But as far as using something like [0…9] or [‘a’…‘z’,‘A’…‘Z’]
You can’t do that.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you do Sets in scar?

Can you do Sets in scar?

Like it shows here. Scroll down to Key/Shift paramaters.

How to Process & Understand Keyboard Events in Delphi

Get familiar with the OnKeyDown, OnKeyUp, and onKeyPress Delphi event procedures to respond to various key actions.

This would reaaaally help, I hope it’s in there.
